common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_description: Understand what an exponent represents (repeated multiplication).
description: This skill introduces the fundamental concept of exponents as a shorthand for repeated multiplication.  Students will learn that an exponent indicates how many times the base number is multiplied by itself.
common_pitfalls: Confusing the exponent with multiplication (e.g., 34 is not 3×4).  Not understanding that the exponent applies only to the base it's directly next to (e.g., in −22, the negative sign is not part of the base).

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_description: Convert repeated multiplication into exponential form.
description: Students will practice converting expressions involving repeated multiplication into exponential notation.  This solidifies their understanding of the structure of an exponential term.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly identifying the base or the exponent.  Forgetting to include a base when the number 1 is multiplied repeatedly (e.g., 1×1×1=13).

IXL: IXL Content-Write multiplication expressions using exponents

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_name: Evaluate Powers with Whole Number Bases
skill_description: Calculate the value of expressions with whole number bases and whole number exponents.
description: This skill focuses on calculating the numerical value of exponential expressions where the base is a whole number.  Students will apply their understanding of repeated multiplication to arrive at a single numerical answer.
common_pitfalls: Calculation errors (e.g., 25=10 instead of 32).  Multiplying the base by the exponent instead of repeated multiplication.

IXL: IXL Content-Evaluate powers with whole number bases

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_description: Calculate the value of expressions with whole number bases and whole number exponents.
description: This skill provides extensive practice in evaluating powers with various whole number bases and exponents.  It reinforces the procedural understanding developed in the previous skill, ensuring fluency.
common_pitfalls: Repeating previous calculation errors.  Not recognizing that 1x=1 and x1=x.

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_name: Write Powers of Ten with Exponents
skill_description: Express powers of ten using exponential notation and understand their value.
description: Students will specifically learn to express powers of ten using exponential notation and understand their connection to place value.  This builds a foundation for scientific notation and understanding large numbers.
common_pitfalls: Confusing the number of zeros with the exponent (e.g., 100 has two zeros, so it's 102, not 103).

IXL: IXL Content-Write powers of ten with exponents

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_name: Find the Missing Exponent or Base
skill_description: Determine the unknown exponent or base in an exponential equation.
description: This skill challenges students to work backward, determining an unknown exponent or base given the exponential expression and its value.  This encourages deeper conceptual understanding.
common_pitfalls: Guessing and checking without a strategy.  Not systematically testing possibilities.

IXL: IXL Content-Find the missing exponent or base

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_description: Calculate the value of expressions with fractional or decimal bases and whole number exponents.
description: This skill extends the understanding of exponents to include fractional and decimal bases.  Students will learn that the principle of repeated multiplication applies regardless of the type of number being used as the base.
common_pitfalls: Applying the exponent only to the numerator or denominator of a fraction (e.g., (1/2)^3 = 1^3/2 instead of 1^3/2^3).  Misplacing the decimal point in decimal calculations.

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_description: Calculate the value of expressions with decimal bases and whole number exponents.
description: Students will practice calculating the numerical value of exponential expressions where the base is a decimal.  This requires careful attention to decimal multiplication.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly counting decimal places in the product.  Calculation errors in multiplication of decimals.

IXL: IXL Content-Evaluate powers with decimal bases

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_description: Calculate the value of expressions with fractional bases and whole number exponents.
description: Students will practice calculating the numerical value of exponential expressions where the base is a fraction.  This involves understanding how exponents apply to both the numerator and the denominator.
common_pitfalls: Only applying the exponent to one part of the fraction.  Forgetting to simplify the resulting fraction if possible.

IXL: IXL Content-Evaluate powers with fractional bases

common_core_description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.
skill_name: Evaluate Powers with Whole Number, Decimal, and Fractional Bases
skill_description: Calculate the value of expressions with whole number, decimal, or fractional bases and whole number exponents.
description: This skill consolidates all previous evaluation skills, requiring students to compute values of powers with various types of bases (whole numbers, decimals, and fractions) in a mixed set of problems.  This ensures a comprehensive understanding and ability to apply the concept broadly.
common_pitfalls: Reverting to previous errors when faced with mixed problem types.  Forgetting specific rules for decimal or fractional multiplication.

IXL: IXL Content-Evaluate powers with whole number, decimal, and fractional bases

common_core_description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.
skill_description: Develop an intuitive understanding of how changes in variable values affect the value of an expression.
description: This skill aims to develop an intuitive understanding of how the value of an expression changes based on the numbers involved and the operations applied.  It encourages estimation and reasoning rather than precise calculation initially.
common_pitfalls: Jumping to calculation without considering the structure.  Not recognizing the impact of different operations (e.g., addition vs. multiplication).

common_core_description: Write expressions that record operations with numbers and with letters standing for numbers.
skill_description: Translate simple verbal phrases into algebraic expressions involving one operation.
description: Students will learn to translate simple verbal phrases into algebraic expressions involving a single arithmetic operation (addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division).  This is a foundational step in algebraic thinking.
common_pitfalls: Confusing operation words (e.g., "less than" implies subtraction in reverse order).  Not using a variable.

common_core_description: Write an inequality of the form *x > c* or *x < c* to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. common_core_description: Write an inequality of the form *x > c* or *x < c* to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. common_core_description: Write an inequality of the form *x > c* or *x < c* to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. common_core_description: Write an inequality of the form *x > c* or *x < c* to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. common_core_description: Write an inequality of the form *x > c* or *x < c* to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. common_core_description: Write an inequality of the form *x > c* or *x < c* to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. common_core_description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another; write an equation to express one quantity, thought of as the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, thought of as the independent variable. common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Understand area as the amount of two-dimensional space a shape covers, often by tiling with unit squares.
description: This skill introduces the fundamental concept of area as the measure of the two-dimensional space a surface covers, quantified by the number of unit squares required to tile it without gaps or overlaps.
common_pitfalls: Confusing area with perimeter.  Not understanding that area is measured in square units.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 1: Tiling the Plane

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

skill_description: Determine the area of a figure by counting the number of given unit squares or composite unit shapes (like triangles) that cover it.
description: Students will calculate the area of simple shapes drawn on a grid by directly counting the number of full and partial unit squares (or other given unit shapes) they occupy.
common_pitfalls: Miscounting squares. Not accurately estimating partial squares. Confusing rows/columns with total squares.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 1: Tiling the Plane

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Recognize and name various polygons based on their properties (e.g., number of sides, angles).
