common_pitfalls: Confusing polygons with non-polygons (e.g., circles, shapes with curves). Miscounting sides.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 11: Polygons

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Calculate the area of rectangles and squares using formulas.
description: Students will learn and apply the formulas for calculating the area of rectangles (A=l×w) and squares (A=s2).
common_pitfalls: Confusing area with perimeter. Incorrectly multiplying length and width. Forgetting to use square units in the answer.

IXL: IXL Content-Area of rectangles and squares

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Visually and conceptually understand how the area of a parallelogram relates to the area of a rectangle through decomposition and rearrangement.
description: This skill focuses on the conceptual understanding that a parallelogram can be transformed into an equivalent rectangle by cutting and rearranging a triangular section. This visually justifies the area formula.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty visualizing the transformation. Not understanding why the 'slant' height isn't used.

IXL: IXL Content-Understanding area of a parallelogram

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Identify Base and Height of Parallelograms
skill_description: Correctly identify the base and corresponding height in different parallelogram orientations.
description: Students will learn to correctly identify the base and its corresponding perpendicular height in various orientations of parallelograms. This is crucial for applying the area formula accurately.
common_pitfalls: Confusing the slanted side with the height. Not recognizing that height must be perpendicular to the base.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 5: Bases and Heights of Parallelograms

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Apply the formula to find the area of any parallelogram.
description: Students will apply the formula A=b×h to find the area of parallelograms given their base and height measurements.
common_pitfalls: Using the slanted side as the height. Calculation errors. Forgetting units.

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Understand that the area of a triangle is half the area of a corresponding parallelogram or rectangle.
description: Students will understand that a triangle's area is exactly half of a parallelogram (or rectangle) with the same base and height. This conceptual insight explains the 1/2 in the triangle area formula.
common_pitfalls: Not clearly seeing how two identical triangles form a parallelogram.

IXL: IXL Content-Understanding area of a triangle

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Identify Base and Height of Triangles
skill_description: Correctly identify the base and corresponding height in various triangle orientations.
description: Students will correctly identify the base and its corresponding perpendicular height for various types of triangles (acute, obtuse, right) and orientations.
common_pitfalls: Confusing a side with the height. Not recognizing the need for perpendicularity.

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Calculate Area of Triangles (including right triangles)
skill_description: Apply the formula to find the area of any triangle, including right triangles.
description: Students will apply the formula A=1/2bh to find the area of various triangles, including special cases like right triangles where sides can also serve as base/height.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting the 1/2. Using the wrong side for height in right triangles. Calculation errors with fractions or decimals.

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Understand how trapezoids can be decomposed or composed to find their area.
description: Students will develop an understanding of the trapezoid area formula by seeing how a trapezoid can be rearranged into a parallelogram or by dividing it into a rectangle and triangles.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty visualizing the transformation. Not understanding why both bases are summed.

IXL: IXL Content-Understanding area of a trapezoid

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Apply the formula or decomposition methods to find the area of trapezoids.
description: Students will apply the formula A=1/2h(b1+b2) to find the area of trapezoids given the lengths of their parallel bases and their height.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting the 1/2. Not adding the bases first. Errors in calculation.

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Find the area of rhombuses using appropriate methods, including decomposition.
description: Students will apply the formula for the area of a rhombus, A=1/2d1d2, where d1 and d2 are the lengths of the diagonals.
common_pitfalls: Confusing diagonals with sides. Forgetting the 1/2. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content-Area of rhombuses

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Decompose and Compose Shapes to Find Area
skill_description: Break down complex shapes into simpler ones (decomposition) or combine simpler shapes to form complex ones (composition) to find their area.
description: This skill introduces the strategy of breaking down complex irregular polygons into simpler, familiar shapes (like rectangles, triangles, parallelograms) whose areas can be calculated, and then summing those areas. It also covers combining simpler shapes to form a larger one.
common_pitfalls: Not identifying all the component shapes. Incorrectly drawing the decomposition lines.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 2: Finding Area by Decomposing and Rearranging

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Find Areas of Polygons Using Reasoning Strategies (Decomposing, Rearranging, Subtracting)
skill_description: Employ advanced strategies like decomposing, rearranging, or subtracting areas of simpler shapes to find the area of more complex polygons.
description: Students will employ various problem-solving strategies, including decomposing, rearranging, and subtracting areas, to determine the total area of irregular or composite polygons presented on a grid or with dimensions. This encourages flexible thinking.
common_pitfalls: Not choosing the most efficient strategy. Errors in decomposition or subtraction. Missing parts of the area.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 3: Reasoning to Find Area

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Find the total area of shapes made up of multiple basic polygons by decomposing them.
description: This skill focuses on the procedural calculation of the total area of composite figures composed of known polygons (rectangles, squares, triangles, parallelograms, trapezoids), applying the appropriate formulas for each part and summing them.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to add all areas. Incorrectly identifying dimensions for sub-shapes. Calculation errors.

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Find Missing Dimensions Given Area of Parallelograms
skill_description: Solve for an unknown base or height when given the area of a parallelogram.
description: Students will use the area formula for parallelograms (A=b×h) and inverse operations to determine a missing base or height when the area and one dimension are given.
common_pitfalls: Using multiplication instead of division. Calculation errors.

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Find Missing Dimensions Given Area of Triangles
skill_description: Solve for an unknown base or height when given the area of a triangle.
description: Students will use the area formula for triangles (A=1/2bh) and inverse operations to determine a missing base or height when the area and one dimension are given. This often involves multiplying by 2 before dividing.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to multiply the area by 2. Incorrectly applying inverse operations. Calculation errors.

common_core_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Apply area calculation skills to solve practical problems in various contexts.
description: This culminating skill requires students to apply all learned area concepts (formulas, decomposition, missing dimensions) to solve practical, real-world problems. This tests their ability to translate scenarios into mathematical problems and execute solutions.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem to choose the correct formula or strategy. Calculation errors. Forgetting units or incorrectly using units in context.

IXL: IXL Content-Area of quadrilaterals and triangles: word problems

common_core_description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Volume of Rectangular Prisms (Whole Number Sides)
skill_description: Calculate the volume of rectangular prisms with whole number side lengths.
description: This foundational skill introduces the concept of volume as the amount of three-dimensional space an object occupies, measured in cubic units.  Students will calculate the volume of rectangular prisms with whole number side lengths by counting unit cubes or by applying the formula V=l×w×h.
common_pitfalls: Confusing volume with area or surface area. Miscounting cubes. Forgetting to use cubic units.

IXL: IXL Content-Volume of cubes and rectangular prisms

common_core_description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Conceptual Understanding of Volume with Fractional Unit Cubes
skill_description: Understand volume by packing rectangular prisms with unit cubes of fractional edge lengths.
description: This skill extends the understanding of volume to include cases where dimensions are not whole numbers.  Students will visualize how fractional unit cubes (e.g., 1/2×1/2×1/2) can fill a rectangular prism, solidifying the idea that volume is based on the product of dimensions regardless of their type.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty visualizing fractional units. Not connecting fractional dimensions to the concept of multiplication.

common_core_description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Volume by Multiplying Area of Base by Height (V=Bh)
skill_description: Understand and apply the formula V=Bh for calculating volume.
description: Students will learn and apply the generalized volume formula for rectangular prisms, V=B×h, where B represents the area of the base.  This emphasizes the relationship between 2D area and 3D volume.
common_pitfalls: Confusing base (B) with base length (b). Calculation errors.

common_core_description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Calculate the volume of rectangular prisms with fractional or decimal edge lengths.
description: Students will calculate the volume of rectangular prisms when the dimensions involve fractions or decimals, requiring proficiency in multiplying rational numbers.
common_pitfalls: Errors in decimal or fraction multiplication.  Forgetting to convert mixed numbers to improper fractions before multiplying.

IXL: IXL Content-Volume of cubes and rectangular prisms with fractional side lengths

common_core_description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Solve real-world problems involving the volume of rectangular prisms with fractional or decimal dimensions.
description: Students will apply volume calculation skills to solve real-world problems where the dimensions of rectangular prisms might be fractions or decimals.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem to identify dimensions.  Calculation errors with rational numbers.  Not understanding the context of the answer.

common_core_description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Find Missing Dimensions Given Volume of Prisms
skill_description: Determine an unknown length, width, or height when given the volume of a rectangular prism.
description: Students will use the volume formula (V=l×w×h or V=B×h) and inverse operations to determine an unknown length, width, or height of a rectangular prism when its volume and other dimensions are given.
common_pitfalls: Using multiplication instead of division.  Incorrectly isolating the unknown variable.  Calculation errors with larger numbers or rational numbers.

IXL: IXL Content-Volume of cubes and rectangular prisms: word problems

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Identify axes, origin, and quadrants, and understand how coordinates locate points.
description: This foundational skill introduces students to the structure and components of the coordinate plane, including the axes, origin, and quadrants. They will learn the vocabulary associated with plotting points.
common_pitfalls: Confusing the x-axis and y-axis. Mixing up positive and negative directions. Incorrectly identifying quadrants.
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Graph Points in All Four Quadrants
skill_description: Accurately plot points on the coordinate plane given their ordered pairs.
description: Students will develop the procedural skill of accurately plotting points on the coordinate plane given their ordered pairs, in all four quadrants.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly identifying the x or y direction. Transposing coordinates (e.g., plotting (4,3) instead of (3,4)).
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Connect plotted points to form polygons on the coordinate plane.
description: Students will apply their plotting skills to construct polygons on the coordinate plane by connecting a given set of ordered pairs (vertices) in order.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly plotting points. Not connecting points in the correct order.
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane
sub_cluster_name: Geometric Figures on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Find Horizontal and Vertical Distances on Coordinate Plane
skill_description: Calculate the length of horizontal or vertical segments by counting units or using coordinate differences.
description: This skill teaches students to calculate the length of horizontal or vertical line segments between two points on the coordinate plane by using absolute value or by counting units.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly using absolute value (e.g., 7−2 vs ∣7−2∣ for positive differences). Errors with negative coordinates (e.g., −5 to 1 is not 4 units).
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane
sub_cluster_name: Geometric Figures on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Calculate Perimeter of Rectangles/Squares on Coordinate Plane
skill_description: Use coordinate points to find side lengths and then calculate the perimeter of rectangles and squares.
description: Students will find the perimeter of rectangles and squares whose vertices are given on a coordinate plane. This requires finding side lengths using horizontal/vertical distances and then applying perimeter formulas.
common_pitfalls: Calculation errors for side lengths. Forgetting the perimeter formula.
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane
sub_cluster_name: Geometric Figures on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Calculate Area of Rectangles/Squares on Coordinate Plane
skill_description: Use coordinate points to find side lengths and then calculate the area of rectangles and squares.
description: Students will find the area of rectangles and squares whose vertices are given on a coordinate plane. This requires finding side lengths using horizontal/vertical distances and then applying area formulas.
common_pitfalls: Calculation errors for side lengths. Forgetting the area formula. Forgetting square units in the answer.
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane
sub_cluster_name: Geometric Figures on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Solve Quadrilateral Problems on the Coordinate Plane
skill_description: Solve problems involving quadrilaterals by analyzing their properties on the coordinate plane.
description: This skill broadens the application of coordinate geometry to general quadrilateral properties. Students might be asked to identify a type of quadrilateral given vertices, or calculate area/perimeter using methods appropriate for more complex quadrilaterals (e.g., decomposition).
common_pitfalls: Misidentifying quadrilateral types. Errors in finding perpendicular height for parallelograms or trapezoids.
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane
sub_cluster_name: Geometric Figures on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Solve Real-World Problems on the Coordinate Plane
skill_description: Apply coordinate geometry skills to solve practical problems involving distances or shapes.
description: This culminating skill involves applying coordinate geometry concepts to solve practical problems that require plotting points, calculating distances, or finding areas/perimeters in a real-world context.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem context. Errors in plotting, calculating distances, or applying formulas. Forgetting units in the answer.
cluster_name: Points, Polygons, & Distances on the Coordinate Plane
sub_cluster_name: Geometric Figures on the Coordinate Plane

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Recognize and differentiate between common polyhedra like prisms and pyramids.
description: This foundational skill introduces students to common three-dimensional geometric shapes, focusing on polyhedra, and their key characteristics (faces, edges, vertices).
common_pitfalls: Confusing 2D and 3D shapes. Miscounting faces, edges, or vertices.

IXL: IXL Content-Identify polyhedra

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Understand and Identify Nets of 3D Figures
skill_description: Understand that a net is a 2D representation of a 3D figure that can be folded to form the figure.
description: This skill introduces the concept of a net as a 2D pattern that can be folded to form a 3D figure. Students will identify which nets correspond to specific 3D shapes.
common_pitfalls: Not visualizing the folding correctly. Confusing nets for different prisms or pyramids.

IXL: IXL Content-Nets of three-dimensional figures

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Create accurate 2D nets for given three-dimensional figures.
description: Students will create their own nets for given three-dimensional shapes, demonstrating their understanding of how a 3D figure unfolds into a 2D representation.
common_pitfalls: Missing faces. Incorrectly arranging faces so they don't connect properly when folded.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 15: More Nets, More Surface Area

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Calculate Area of Faces in a Net
skill_description: Find the area of each individual rectangular and triangular face shown in a net.
description: This preparatory skill focuses on finding the area of each individual polygonal face within a given net, using previously learned area formulas.
common_pitfalls: Calculation errors for individual areas.

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Conceptual Understanding of Surface Area from Nets
skill_description: Understand that the total area of a net represents the surface area of the 3D figure.
description: This skill establishes the conceptual link between a net and the total surface area of a 3D figure. Students will understand that surface area is the sum of the areas of all the faces represented in its net.
common_pitfalls: Confusing surface area with volume. Not understanding that all faces must be included.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 12: What Is Surface Area?

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Calculate Surface Area of Cubes and Rectangular Prisms (using nets)
skill_description: Find the surface area of cubes and rectangular prisms by summing the areas of all faces from their nets.
description: Students will calculate the surface area of cubes and rectangular prisms by finding the area of each face in their net and summing them. This solidifies the procedural approach.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to include all 6 faces. Incorrectly calculating the area of individual faces. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content-Surface area of cubes and rectangular prisms

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Calculate Surface Area of Triangular Prisms (using nets)
skill_description: Determine the surface area of triangular prisms by finding the sum of the areas of their rectangular and triangular faces from their nets.
description: Students will compute the surface area of triangular prisms by finding the area of their two triangular bases and three rectangular faces from a net, then summing them.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to include all 5 faces. Using incorrect dimensions for rectangular faces. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content-Surface area of triangular prisms

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Calculate Surface Area of Pyramids (using nets)
skill_description: Compute the surface area of pyramids by adding the area of the base and all triangular faces from their nets.
description: Students will compute the surface area of pyramids (square and triangular) by finding the area of the base and all triangular faces from a net, then summing them.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to include the base area. Using the wrong height (e.g., prism height instead of slant height for triangular faces). Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content-Surface area of pyramids

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Formulate algebraic expressions to represent the calculation of surface area for various 3D figures.
description: Students will translate the process of finding surface area into algebraic expressions, demonstrating a more abstract understanding of the formulas.
common_pitfalls: Missing terms in the expression. Incorrectly combining terms.

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_description: Apply surface area concepts to solve practical problems such as painting, wrapping, or packaging.
description: This culminating skill requires students to apply surface area concepts to solve practical problems that involve calculating the amount of material needed to cover a 3D object.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem context (e.g., "no bottom"). Calculation errors. Forgetting units or using incorrect units.

common_core_description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.
skill_name: Differentiate Between Surface Area and Volume
skill_description: Understand the distinct differences between surface area (amount of covering) and volume (amount of space occupied).
description: This skill ensures students clearly understand the conceptual distinction between surface area (amount of covering) and volume (amount of space inside), and when to apply each concept.
common_pitfalls: Confusing the two concepts. Applying the wrong formula to a given scenario.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content-Lesson 16: Distinguishing between Surface Area and Volume (Optional)

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Understanding the Meaning of Division with Fractions (How Many Groups?)
description: This skill introduces the "measurement" or "how many groups of" interpretation of division, specifically applied to fractions. Students will understand that dividing a quantity by a fraction means determining how many times that fraction fits into the quantity.
common_pitfalls: Only thinking of division as "sharing." Not understanding the conceptual question being asked.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 4: How Many Groups? (Part 1)

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Understanding the Meaning of Division with Fractions (What Fraction of a Group?)
description: This skill focuses on the "partitive" or "what fraction of a group" interpretation of division. Students will understand that dividing a quantity by a fraction can mean finding what fractional part of a full group a smaller quantity represents.
common_pitfalls: Confusing this interpretation with "how many groups."

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 7: What Fraction of a Group?

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Understanding the Meaning of Division with Fractions (How Much in Each Group?)
description: This skill explores the "partitive" or "sharing" interpretation of division, specifically when the divisor is a fraction. Students will understand how to find the amount in each group when a quantity is divided into a fractional number of groups.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty conceptualizing a "fractional number of groups."

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 8: How Much in Each Group? (Part 1)

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Representing Division of Fractions with Visual Models (Unit Fractions)
description: Students will use various visual models (e.g., fraction bars, number lines, diagrams) to represent and solve division problems where a whole number or fraction is divided by a unit fraction.
common_pitfalls: Inaccurate drawing of models. Not correctly representing the divisor or dividend.

IXL: IXL Content - M.1 Divide whole numbers by unit fractions using models

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Representing Division of Fractions with Visual Models (Non-Unit Fractions)
description: Students will extend their use of visual models to represent and solve division problems involving non-unit fractions as divisors.
common_pitfalls: Models becoming overly complex. Difficulty accurately showing non-unit fraction parts.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 6: Using Diagrams to Find the Number of Groups

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
description: This skill introduces the concept of a reciprocal and how to find it for any given fraction, which is crucial for understanding the standard division algorithm.
common_pitfalls: Confusing reciprocal with opposite. Not correctly converting whole numbers or mixed numbers to fractions first.

IXL: IXL Content - M.2 Reciprocals

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Dividing Whole Numbers by Unit Fractions
description: Students will perform division of whole numbers by unit fractions, beginning to connect visual understanding with the multiplication-by-reciprocal concept.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to multiply by the reciprocal. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - M.3 Divide whole numbers and unit fractions

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
description: Students will perform division of whole numbers by any fraction (unit or non-unit).
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to multiply by the reciprocal. Errors in fraction multiplication.

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Dividing Fractions by Whole Numbers (in recipes)
description: Students will perform division of fractions by whole numbers, often in practical scenarios like scaling down recipes.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the division problem from the word problem. Errors in fraction multiplication/division.

IXL: IXL Content - M.5 Divide fractions by whole numbers in recipes

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
description: Students will solve fraction division problems (fraction by fraction, mixed numbers by fraction) using visual models, reinforcing conceptual understanding before relying solely on algorithms.
common_pitfalls: Inaccurate or confusing models. Difficulty representing the "groups of" when both are fractions.

IXL: IXL Content - M.6 Divide fractions using models

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
description: This skill deepens the conceptual understanding of dividing one fraction by another, building intuition for why "invert and multiply" works.
common_pitfalls: Struggling to articulate the "how many groups" or "what fraction of a group" interpretation when both are fractions.

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Dividing Fractions using the Standard Algorithm
description: Students will fluently apply the standard algorithm (multiply by the reciprocal) to divide fractions by fractions.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to invert the second fraction. Inverting the first fraction. Errors in multiplication or simplification.

IXL: IXL Content - M.7 Divide fractions

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
description: Students will use visual models to represent and solve division problems involving mixed numbers, reinforcing the conceptual basis before algorithmic fluency.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty drawing or interpreting models for mixed numbers.

IXL: IXL Content - M.9 Divide fractions and mixed numbers using models

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Dividing Mixed Numbers using the Standard Algorithm
description: Students will fluently apply the standard algorithm to divide mixed numbers, which requires converting to improper fractions first.
common_pitfalls: Not converting mixed numbers to improper fractions. Errors in converting. Errors in subsequent fraction multiplication.

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Estimating Quotients when Dividing Mixed Numbers
description: Students will develop the skill of estimating the result of dividing mixed numbers by rounding to the nearest whole number or friendly fraction, helping them check the reasonableness of their precise answers.
common_pitfalls: Inaccurate rounding. Not understanding how the operations affect the estimate.

IXL: IXL Content - M.8 Estimate quotients when dividing mixed numbers

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Division of Fractions (Basic)
description: This skill focuses on translating simple word problems into fraction division equations and solving them. These problems often involve a whole number being divided by a fraction or a fraction being divided by a whole number.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem to set up the correct division.

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Division of Fractions by Fractions
description: This skill extends word problems to include scenarios where a fraction is divided by another fraction.
common_pitfalls: Setting up the division incorrectly (e.g., inverting the dividend instead of the divisor).

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Division of Fractions and Mixed Numbers (Models)
description: Students will use visual models (e.g., number lines, area models, diagrams) to represent and solve word problems that involve division of mixed numbers and fractions. This reinforces conceptual understanding.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty drawing accurate and clear models for mixed numbers. Misinterpreting the model to get the final answer.

IXL: IXL Content - M.11 Divide fractions and mixed numbers using models: word problems

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Division of Fractions and Mixed Numbers
description: This skill focuses on solving various word problems that involve division, where both fractions and mixed numbers may be present. Students will primarily use the standard algorithm after setting up the problem.
common_pitfalls: Setting up the problem incorrectly. Errors in converting mixed numbers to improper fractions or performing the division calculation.

IXL: IXL Content - M.12 Divide fractions and mixed numbers: word problems

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Applying Division and Multiplication to Fractional Lengths
description: This skill requires students to use both multiplication and division with fractions to solve problems related to lengths, perimeters, or areas involving fractional dimensions.
common_pitfalls: Confusing which operation (multiplication or division) to use. Errors in fractional arithmetic.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 12: Fractional Lengths

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Finding Unknown Side Lengths of Rectangles with Fractional Measurements
description: Students will apply their understanding of area and fractional division to determine a missing dimension of a rectangle when its area and one fractional side length are given. This is an inverse problem.
common_pitfalls: Setting up the division problem incorrectly (e.g., dividing the known side by the area). Errors in fractional division.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 13: Rectangles with Fractional Side Lengths

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Understanding the Connection between Volume and Fractional Edge Lengths
description: This skill focuses on the conceptual understanding of how fractional edge lengths contribute to the overall volume of a three-dimensional rectangular prism. It often involves visualizing filling a prism with unit cubes of fractional size.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty visualizing or reasoning about fractional cubic units. Confusing units (e.g., length vs. volume).

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 14: Fractional Lengths in Triangles and Prisms

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Finding the Volume of Prisms with Fractional Edge Lengths
description: Students will apply the volume formula (V=l×w×h) to calculate the volume of rectangular prisms where the dimensions are given as fractions or mixed numbers.
common_pitfalls: Errors in multiplying three fractions or mixed numbers. Forgetting to use cubic units.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 15: Volume of Prisms

common_core_description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.
skill_name: Solving Complex Word Problems Involving Fractions (Mixed Operations)
description: This is a culminating skill that requires students to solve multi-step real-world problems that integrate various fraction operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division).
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the entire problem scenario. Performing operations in the wrong order. Making calculation errors with mixed operations.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 16: Solving Problems Involving Fractions

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
description: This skill introduces students to common divisibility rules (e.g., for 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 10). Applying these rules allows students to quickly determine if one whole number can be divided by another without a remainder, which aids in mental math, simplification, and estimation.
common_pitfalls: Misapplying specific rules (e.g., confusing the rule for 3 with the rule for 9). Forgetting rules.

IXL: IXL Content - C.1 Divisibility rules

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
description: Students will identify and apply patterns that emerge when dividing whole numbers that end in zeros by powers of ten (10, 100, 1000). This skill builds mental math efficiency.
common_pitfalls: Miscounting or incorrectly removing zeros.

IXL: IXL Content - C.2 Division patterns with zeros

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
description: This skill teaches students to estimate the result of a whole number division problem by rounding the dividend and/or divisor to compatible (friendly) numbers. This is vital for checking the reasonableness of answers.
common_pitfalls: Rounding to numbers that are not easy to divide. Not considering the effect of rounding on the estimate.

IXL: IXL Content - C.4 Estimate quotients

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
skill_name: Dividing Numbers Ending in Zeros: Word Problems
description: Students will apply their understanding of division patterns with zeros to solve simple real-world problems.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem to identify the divisor and dividend.

IXL: IXL Content - C.3 Divide numbers ending in zeros: word problems

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
description: Students will perform long division with multi-digit whole numbers, specifically focusing on problems with two-digit divisors. This skill builds procedural fluency in the standard algorithm.
common_pitfalls: Errors in multiplication or subtraction steps within the algorithm. Difficulty estimating partial quotients.

IXL: IXL Content - C.5 Divide whole numbers - 2-digit divisors

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
description: Students will extend their long division skills to problems involving three-digit divisors, requiring more advanced estimation and computational precision.
common_pitfalls: Increased difficulty with estimation. More complex multiplication and subtraction steps.

IXL: IXL Content - C.6 Divide whole numbers - 3-digit divisors

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
skill_name: Multi-digit Division using the Standard Algorithm
description: This skill aims for mastery of the standard algorithm for multi-digit division, encompassing various scenarios including those with and without remainders. Students should be able to perform these calculations efficiently and accurately.
common_pitfalls: Consistent errors in any step of the long division process (estimation, multiplication, subtraction, bringing down digits). Not writing remainders correctly.

common_core_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Multi-Digit Division
description: Students will apply their multi-digit division skills to solve real-world problems, often involving larger numbers and requiring careful interpretation of the scenario.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem to set up the division correctly. Performing calculation errors. Not understanding how to handle remainders in context (e.g., rounding up or down).

IXL: IXL Content - Divide whole numbers: word problems

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: Students will perform addition with decimal numbers of varying lengths, ensuring proper alignment of decimal points. This is a foundational skill for decimal arithmetic.
common_pitfalls: Not aligning decimal points. Incorrectly placing the decimal point in the sum. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - H.1 Add and subtract decimal numbers

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: Students will perform subtraction with decimal numbers of varying lengths, ensuring proper alignment of decimal points and borrowing when necessary.
common_pitfalls: Not aligning decimal points. Incorrectly placing the decimal point in the difference. Errors in borrowing or regrouping.

IXL: IXL Content - H.1 Add and subtract decimal numbers

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: This skill specifically targets adding decimal numbers that extend to the thousandths place, requiring careful attention to place value alignment.
common_pitfalls: Misaligning digits, especially when one number has fewer decimal places.

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: This skill specifically targets subtracting decimal numbers that extend to the thousandths place, often requiring adding trailing zeros to align digits for subtraction.
common_pitfalls: Not adding trailing zeros to the number with fewer decimal places, leading to incorrect borrowing.

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Estimating Sums and Differences of Decimals
description: Students will learn to estimate the results of decimal addition and subtraction by rounding the decimal numbers to the nearest whole number or a specified decimal place.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly rounding decimals.

IXL: IXL Content - H.5 Estimate sums and differences of decimals

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Adding and Subtracting Decimals: Word Problems
description: Students will apply their skills in adding and subtracting decimals to solve real-world problems.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the problem to determine the correct operation. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - H.2 Add and subtract decimals: word problems

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Completing Decimal Addition or Subtraction Sentences
description: Students will fill in missing numbers (addends or subtrahends/minuends) in decimal addition and subtraction equations, often requiring inverse operations.
common_pitfalls: Not correctly applying inverse operations. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - H.4 Complete the decimal addition or subtraction sentence

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: This skill focuses on the conceptual understanding of decimal multiplication, particularly how the number of decimal places in the factors determines the number of decimal places in the product. It often involves using estimation or visual models.
common_pitfalls: Not understanding the connection between decimal places in factors and product. Misplacing the decimal point due to lack of conceptual understanding.

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: Students will estimate the results of decimal multiplication by rounding the decimal numbers to the nearest whole number or a convenient decimal place.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly rounding decimals.

IXL: IXL Content - I.1 Estimate products of decimal numbers

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: Students will apply the standard algorithm to multiply decimal numbers, correctly handling the placement of the decimal point in the product.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly counting decimal places for the product. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - I.3 Multiply decimals

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: This skill provides focused practice on multiplying decimals with a higher number of decimal places, solidifying the procedural fluency of the standard algorithm.
common_pitfalls: Miscounting total decimal places. Increased chance of calculation errors due to more digits.

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: Students will perform division of decimals by whole numbers, placing the decimal point in the quotient correctly.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to place the decimal point directly above the dividend's decimal point. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - I.5 Divide decimals by whole numbers

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Dividing Whole Numbers to Get a Decimal
description: Students will perform division of whole numbers that result in decimal quotients, requiring them to add a decimal point and zeros to the dividend as needed.
common_pitfalls: Not knowing when to add zeros. Incorrectly extending the division.

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: This skill provides focused practice on dividing decimals up to the hundredths place, reinforcing the process of long division with decimals.
common_pitfalls: Errors in moving the decimal point in the divisor and dividend.

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: This skill extends practice to dividing decimals up to the thousandths place, involving more complex decimal shifts.
common_pitfalls: Errors in moving the decimal point, especially with multiple shifts. Calculation errors with more digits.

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: Students will estimate the results of decimal division by rounding decimals to compatible whole numbers or simpler decimals.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly rounding. Difficulty identifying compatible numbers for division.

IXL: IXL Content - I.8 Estimate decimal quotients

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: This skill focuses on the procedural fluency of dividing by a decimal divisor by converting the divisor into a whole number (by multiplying both divisor and dividend by a power of ten).
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to move the decimal point in the dividend as well as the divisor. Incorrectly moving the decimal point.

IXL: IXL Content - I.9 Division with decimal divisors

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Multiplying and Dividing Decimals by Powers of Ten
description: Students will understand and apply the rule for quickly multiplying and dividing decimals by powers of ten (10, 100, 1000, etc.) by shifting the decimal point.
common_pitfalls: Moving the decimal point in the wrong direction. Miscounting the number of places to move.

IXL: IXL Content - I.7 Multiply and divide decimals by powers of ten

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Addition and Subtraction of Decimals
description: Students will analyze real-world scenarios to determine whether addition or subtraction of decimals is required and then perform the necessary calculations to solve the problem.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting keywords for addition or subtraction. Calculation errors.
sub_cluster_name: Mixed Operations & Problem Solving with Decimals

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Division of Decimals by Whole Numbers
description: Students will solve practical problems that require dividing a decimal quantity by a whole number, often involving sharing or finding averages.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to place the decimal point in the quotient correctly. Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - I.6 Divide decimals by whole numbers: word problems

sub_cluster_name: Mixed Operations & Problem Solving with Decimals

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving Mixed Operations with Decimals
description: This skill challenges students to solve multi-step word problems that involve any combination of two or more decimal operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division). Students must determine the sequence of operations.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly identifying the operations needed. Performing operations in the wrong order. Cumulative calculation errors across multiple steps.

IXL: IXL Content - I.11 Multiply and divide decimals: word problems

sub_cluster_name: Mixed Operations & Problem Solving with Decimals

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Adding, Subtracting, Multiplying, or Dividing Two Decimals
description: This skill provides mixed practice for performing single operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division) on pairs of decimals, requiring students to identify the correct procedure for each given problem.
common_pitfalls: Confusing rules for different operations (e.g., misplacing the decimal in multiplication/division, not aligning for add/subtract).

IXL: IXL Content - J.1 Add, subtract, multiply, or divide two decimals

sub_cluster_name: Mixed Operations & Problem Solving with Decimals

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems with Mixed Operations on Decimals
description: This is a comprehensive skill that requires students to apply all four decimal operations, often in multi-step word problems, to solve complex real-world situations. These problems may involve financial calculations, measurements, or other practical contexts.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty breaking down the problem into manageable steps. Errors in executing multiple operations. Not fully answering all parts of a multi-part question.

IXL: IXL Content - J.2 Add, subtract, multiply, or divide two decimals: word problems

sub_cluster_name: Mixed Operations & Problem Solving with Decimals

common_core_description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.
description: Students will apply the order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS) to evaluate numerical expressions that include various decimal operations and sometimes parentheses.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly applying the order of operations. Calculation errors with decimals.

IXL: IXL Content - J.3 Evaluate numerical expressions involving decimals

sub_cluster_name: Mixed Operations & Problem Solving with Decimals

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_description: Distinguish between prime and composite numbers.
description: This foundational skill introduces students to the definitions of prime and composite numbers.  Students will be able to classify numbers based on their number of factors.
common_pitfalls: Confusing prime with odd.  Thinking 1 is prime.

IXL: IXL Content - F.1 Prime or composite

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_description: List all factors of a given number.
description: Students will learn to systematically list all the positive factors for a given whole number.
common_pitfalls: Missing factors (especially larger ones).  Listing multiples instead of factors.

IXL: IXL Content - F.2 Identify factors

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_name: Finding All Factor Pairs of a Number
skill_description: Identify pairs of factors for a given number.
description: This skill builds on identifying factors by requiring students to list them as pairs whose product is the given number.
common_pitfalls: Missing pairs. Forgetting that a number squared is a pair (e.g., 6×6 for 36).

IXL: IXL Content - F.3 Find all the factor pairs of a number

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_description: Break down numbers into their prime factors.
description: Students will learn to break down a composite number into its prime factors using methods like factor trees or division ladders.
common_pitfalls: Not breaking down composite factors completely.  Including composite numbers in the final prime factorization.

IXL: IXL Content - F.4 Prime factorization

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
description: This skill extends prime factorization by requiring students to express repeated prime factors using exponents.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly applying exponents.  Missing factors or exponents.

IXL: IXL Content - F.5 Prime factorization with exponents

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_name: Finding the Greatest Common Factor (GCF) of Two Numbers
skill_description: Determine the largest common factor between two numbers.
description: Students will determine the largest factor that two given numbers share.  Methods may include listing factors or using prime factorization.
common_pitfalls: Finding a common factor but not the greatest.  Calculation errors.

IXL: IXL Content - F.6 Greatest common factor

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_name: Finding the Greatest Common Factor (GCF) of Three or Four Numbers
skill_description: Determine the GCF for multiple numbers.
description: This skill extends the concept of GCF to more than two numbers, requiring systematic comparison of factors.
common_pitfalls: Missing a common factor that applies to all numbers.

IXL: IXL Content - F.7 Greatest common factor of three or four numbers

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_name: Finding the Least Common Multiple (LCM) of Two Numbers
skill_description: Determine the smallest common multiple between two numbers.
description: Students will determine the smallest positive multiple that two given numbers share.  Methods may include listing multiples or using prime factorization.
common_pitfalls: Finding a common multiple but not the least.  Confusing LCM with GCF.

IXL: IXL Content - F.8 Least common multiple

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_name: Finding the Least Common Multiple (LCM) of Three or Four Numbers
skill_description: Determine the LCM for multiple numbers.
description: This skill extends the concept of LCM to more than two numbers, requiring systematic comparison of multiples.
common_pitfalls: Listing too many multiples.

IXL: IXL Content - F.9 Least common multiple of three or four numbers

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_name: Solving Word Problems Involving GCF and LCM
skill_description: Apply GCF and LCM concepts to solve real-world problems.
description: Students will differentiate between situations requiring GCF and those requiring LCM, then apply the appropriate method to solve real-world problems.
common_pitfalls: Confusing when to use GCF vs. LCM.  Setting up the problem incorrectly.

IXL: IXL Content - F.10 GCF and LCM: word problems

common_core_description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.
skill_name: Using the Distributive Property to Express Sums (e.g., 36 + 8 = 4(9 + 2))
skill_description: Apply the distributive property to rewrite sums.
description: Students will use the GCF to rewrite sums of two whole numbers by factoring out the GCF, demonstrating an understanding of the distributive property in reverse.
common_pitfalls: Not finding the greatest common factor to factor out.  Errors in applying the distributive property.

IXL: IXL Content - F.11 Sort factors of numerical expressions

common_core_description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values; use positive and negative numbers to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation.
skill_name: Exploring Positive and Negative Numbers in Context (Temperature and Elevation)
description: This skill introduces positive and negative numbers as a way to represent quantities with opposite directions or values, using familiar real-world contexts like temperature and elevation.
common_pitfalls: Difficulty associating "below zero" or "below sea level" with negative symbols.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 1: Positive and Negative Numbers

common_core_description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values; use positive and negative numbers to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation.
skill_name: Interpreting Negative Numbers in Real-World Contexts (e.g., money, temperature)
description: Students will interpret the meaning of negative numbers in a variety of real-world contexts, including financial situations (debt), sports scores (yards lost), and geographical measurements (depth).
common_pitfalls: Struggling to assign appropriate real-world meaning to negative values in diverse contexts.

common_core_description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values; use positive and negative numbers to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation.
skill_name: Using Negative Numbers to Make Sense of Contexts
description: This skill involves actively applying negative numbers to represent situations and solve simple conceptual problems within a given context, rather than just interpreting them.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly assigning positive or negative signs.

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 5: Using Negative Numbers to Make Sense of Contexts

common_core_description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values; use positive and negative numbers to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation.
description: Students will learn the formal definition of integers and be able to identify them. This builds on the concept of positive and negative whole numbers.
common_pitfalls: Including fractions or decimals as integers.

IXL: IXL Content - O.1 Understanding integers

common_core_description: Recognize opposite signs of numbers as indicating locations on opposite sides of 0 on the number line; recognize that the opposite of the opposite of a number is the number itself, e.g., –(–3) = 3, and that 0 is its own opposite.
description: This skill introduces the concept of an "opposite" number as a number that is the same distance from zero on a number line but in the opposite direction.
common_pitfalls: Confusing "opposite" with "reciprocal" (for later units).

EngageNY: EngageNY Lessons - Lesson 2: Points on the Number Line

common_core_description: Recognize opposite signs of numbers as indicating locations on opposite sides of 0 on the number line; recognize that the opposite of the opposite of a number is the number itself, e.g., –(–3) = 3, and that 0 is its own opposite.
description: Students will specifically identify the opposite of any given integer, reinforcing the concept within the set of integers.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to change the sign for negative numbers (e.g., saying the opposite of -4 is -4).

IXL: IXL Content - O.4 Understanding opposite integers

common_core_description: Recognize opposite signs of numbers as indicating locations on opposite sides of 0 on the number line; recognize that the opposite of the opposite of a number is the number itself, e.g., –(–3) = 3, and that 0 is its own opposite.
skill_name: Understanding the Negative Symbol as Opposite
description: This skill deepens the understanding of the negative symbol as an operator that indicates the "opposite of." Students will interpret expressions like −(−x).
common_pitfalls: Difficulty with double negatives.

common_pitfalls: Only thinking of opposites for whole numbers.

common_core_description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with negative number coordinates.

common_core_description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with negative number coordinates.

common_core_description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with negative number coordinates.

description: Students will specifically practice placing negative fractions on a number line, requiring an understanding of fractional parts between negative integers.

common_core_description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with negative number coordinates.
skill_name: Representing Negative Decimals on the Number Line

description: Students will specifically practice placing negative decimals on a number line, requiring an understanding of decimal parts between negative integers.

common_core_description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with negative number coordinates.

common_core_description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

common_core_description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

common_core_description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

IXL: IXL Content - Q.4 Compare rational numbers

common_core_description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.
