IXL: IXL Content - Q.5 Put rational numbers in order

common_core_description: Write, interpret, and explain statements of order for rational numbers in real-world contexts.

IXL: IXL Content - Q.6 Compare and order rational numbers: word problems

common_core_description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

common_pitfalls: Not correctly determining the absolute value before ordering.

common_core_description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.
skill_description: Understand the meaning of absolute value in problem-solving.

common_pitfalls: Not relating the absolute value back to the real-world scenario.

common_core_description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

common_core_description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

common_pitfalls: Simple calculation errors.

common_core_description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.
description: Students will translate real-world scenarios presented in word problems into ratio statements, in various forms.

IXL: IXL Content - S.3 Write a ratio: word problems

description: Students will understand the relationship between part-to-part ratios and part-to-whole ratios, and how to derive one from the other.

IXL: IXL Content - S.4 Which model represents the ratio?

common_core_description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b ≠ 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship.

common_pitfalls: Not understanding the "per one unit" aspect.  Confusing rate with ratio.

common_core_description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b ≠ 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship.
description: Students will compute unit rates from given information by dividing the first quantity by the second quantity.

common_core_description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b ≠ 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship.

IXL: IXL Content - S.8 Equivalent ratios: word problems

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Using Equivalent Ratios to Find Unit Prices (How Much for One?)
description: Students will use equivalent ratios to calculate unit prices.
common_pitfalls: Setting up the ratio incorrectly.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content - Lesson 8: How Much for One?

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Using Ratios and Diagrams to Understand Constant Speed
description: Students will use ratios and diagrams to understand and work with the concept of constant speed.
common_pitfalls: Confusing speed with distance or time.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content - Lesson 9: Constant Speed

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Calculating Speed, Distance, or Time: Word Problems
description: Students will solve word problems involving the relationship between speed, distance, and time.
common_pitfalls: Using the wrong formula (e.g., multiplying instead of dividing).

IXL: IXL Content - S.11 Calculate speed, distance, or time: word problems

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Comparing Situations by Examining Ratios (Same Rate)
description: Students will compare different situations by examining their ratios to determine if they share the same rate.
common_pitfalls: Errors in calculating unit rates for comparison.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content - Lesson 10: Comparing Situations by Examining Ratios

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will compare different rates to determine which is faster, slower, better value, etc.
common_pitfalls: Not converting to a common unit or unit rate before comparing.

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will solve word problems that require the comparison of different rates.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the word problem to set up the comparison.

IXL: IXL Content - S.15 Compare rates: word problems

common_core_description: Make tables of equivalent ratios relating quantities with whole-number measurements, find missing values in the tables, and plot the pairs of values on the coordinate plane. Use tables to compare ratios.
description: Students will solve various problems involving equivalent ratios, often using tables or other models.
common_pitfalls: Errors in calculation or setting up proportions.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content - Lesson 14: Solving Equivalent Ratio Problems

common_core_description: Make tables of equivalent ratios relating quantities with whole-number measurements, find missing values in the tables, and plot the pairs of values on the coordinate plane. Use tables to compare ratios.
description: Students will solve word problems that require the comparison of different ratios.
common_pitfalls: Not using a consistent method for comparison (e.g., unit rates, common denominators).

IXL: IXL Content - S.14 Compare ratios: word problems

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Creating Tape Diagrams for Part-Part-Whole Ratio Problems
description: Students will construct tape diagrams specifically for part-part-whole ratio scenarios.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly representing the 'whole' in the diagram.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content - Lesson 15: Part-Part-Whole Ratios

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Solving More Ratio Problems using Number Lines, Tables, and Tape Diagrams
description: This skill consolidates various strategies for solving ratio problems, encouraging students to choose the most appropriate model (number lines, tables, tape diagrams) for a given problem.
common_pitfalls: Choosing an inefficient model for a particular problem.

EngageNY: EngageNY Content - Lesson 16: Solving More Ratio Problems

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Solving Ratio and Rate Word Problems (General)
description: Students will solve a wide range of ratio and rate word problems, applying all concepts learned in the unit.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting complex word problems. Choosing the wrong strategy.

IXL: IXL Content - S.16 Ratios and rates: word problems

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Determining if Ratios Form a Proportion
description: Students will ascertain whether two ratios form a proportion by checking for equivalency.
common_pitfalls: Errors in cross-multiplication or simplification.

IXL: IXL Content - S.17 Do the ratios form a proportion?

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will solve for unknown values in proportional relationships.
common_pitfalls: Errors in algebraic manipulation or cross-multiplication.

IXL: IXL Content - S.18 Solve the proportion

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will apply ratio and proportion concepts to solve problems involving scale drawings.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly setting up the proportion from the scale factor.

IXL: IXL Content - S.19 Scale drawings: word problems

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Graphing Ratios and Rates from a Table
description: Students will take ratio and rate data organized in tables and plot the corresponding ordered pairs onto a coordinate plane.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly plotting points (switching x and y, misjudging scale).

IXL: IXL Content - S.12 Ratios and rates: complete a table and make a graph

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
skill_name: Plotting Ratios on a Coordinate Plane
description: This skill provides direct practice in plotting ratios as ordered pairs on a coordinate plane, reinforcing the connection between ratios and points.
common_pitfalls: Confusing which quantity goes on which axis.

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will learn to recognize that a proportional relationship is represented by a straight line that passes through the origin (0,0) on a coordinate plane.
common_pitfalls: Only looking for a straight line and ignoring the origin.

IXL: IXL Content - T.1 Identify proportional relationships from graphs

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will determine if a table of values represents a proportional relationship by checking if there's a constant ratio (or unit rate) between the corresponding quantities.
common_pitfalls: Not checking all pairs of values. Arithmetic errors when checking ratios.

IXL: IXL Content - T.2 Identify proportional relationships from tables

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will graph points from a given set of data or a table and then use the resulting graph to determine if a proportional relationship exists. This combines plotting and identifying.
common_pitfalls: Inaccurate plotting leading to incorrect conclusions.

IXL: IXL Content - T.3 Identify proportional relationships by graphing

common_core_description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.
description: Students will analyze and extract information from graphs that represent proportional relationships, often in real-world contexts, including finding the unit rate from the graph.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the axes or the scale. Not understanding that the slope represents the unit rate.

IXL: IXL Content - T.4 Interpret graphs of proportional relationships

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: This foundational skill defines percents as a special type of ratio that compares a part to a whole of 100. Students will understand that "percent" means "out of 100."
common_pitfalls: Not understanding the "out of 100" meaning.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will determine percentages by interpreting visual aids such as 10x10 grids (hundreds grids) or shaded areas.
common_pitfalls: Miscounting shaded squares.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will connect percents to fractional models, particularly those easily converted to hundredths (e.g., halves, quarters, tenths).
common_pitfalls: Difficulty with fractions that don't easily convert to hundredths (e.g., thirds).

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will understand and demonstrate the equivalency between fractions, decimals, and percents. This is a core conversion skill.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly moving the decimal point. Errors in fraction simplification.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will convert percents into decimal form by dividing by 100 (or moving the decimal point two places to the left).
common_pitfalls: Moving the decimal point in the wrong direction or the wrong number of places.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will convert decimals into percent form by multiplying by 100 (or moving the decimal point two places to the right and adding a percent sign).
common_pitfalls: Moving the decimal point in the wrong direction or the wrong number of places.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will convert percents into fractional form by writing the percent over 100 and simplifying the fraction.
common_pitfalls: Not simplifying the fraction to its lowest terms.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will utilize common benchmark percents (e.g., 10%, 25%, 50%, 100%) for estimation and quick mental calculations.
common_pitfalls: Not recognizing the fractional equivalents of benchmark percents.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
skill_name: Understanding Equivalent Representations of Percent Problems
description: Students will recognize that percent problems can be expressed in various equivalent forms (e.g., "What is 20% of 50?" vs. "Find 0.20 * 50" vs. "Find 1/5 of 50").
common_pitfalls: Difficulty connecting different forms of representation.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will practice finding a percentage of a number using decimals, fractions, or other methods.
common_pitfalls: Calculation errors. Forgetting to convert the percentage to a decimal or fraction before multiplying.

common_core_description: Find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100 (e.g., 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity); solve problems involving finding the whole, given a part and the percent.
description: Students will apply their knowledge of percents to solve real-world problems, including finding a percent of a number, finding the whole given a part and percent, or finding the percent a part is of a whole.
common_pitfalls: Misidentifying the "part," "whole," or "percent." Calculation errors.

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
skill_name: Understanding Ratios and Units of Measurement
description: Students will understand that unit conversions are essentially ratio problems, where the conversion factor acts as a ratio.
common_pitfalls: Not seeing the underlying ratio in conversion factors.

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
description: Students will develop an intuition for the size of customary units (inches, feet, yards, miles, ounces, pounds, tons, cups, pints, quarts, gallons) by estimating real-world objects.
common_pitfalls: Misunderstanding the relative size of units.

IXL: IXL Content - W.1 Estimate customary measurements

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
description: Students will develop an intuition for the size of metric units (millimeters, centimeters, meters, kilometers, grams, kilograms, milliliters, liters) by estimating real-world objects.
common_pitfalls: Misunderstanding the relative size of metric units.

IXL: IXL Content - W.2 Estimate metric measurements

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
description: Students will convert between common customary units (e.g., feet to inches, pounds to ounces) and use these conversions to compare quantities.
common_pitfalls: Incorrect conversion factors. Errors in multiplication/division.

IXL: IXL Content - W.3 Convert and compare customary units

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
skill_name: Converting, Comparing, Adding, and Subtracting Mixed Customary Units
description: Students will perform operations (addition, subtraction, comparison) with customary units expressed in mixed forms (e.g., 3 feet 6 inches).
common_pitfalls: Not correctly "borrowing" or "carrying" when converting units during operations.

IXL: IXL Content - W.4 Convert, compare, add, and subtract mixed customary units

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
skill_name: Multiplying and Dividing Mixed Customary Units
description: Students will multiply and divide quantities expressed in mixed customary units.
common_pitfalls: Errors in distributing multiplication or handling remainders in division.

IXL: IXL Content - W.5 Multiply and divide mixed customary units

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
skill_name: Customary Unit Conversions Involving Fractions and Mixed Numbers
description: Students will perform conversions between customary units when the quantities are given as fractions or mixed numbers.
common_pitfalls: Errors in fraction multiplication/division.

IXL: IXL Content - W.6 Customary unit conversions involving fractions and mixed numbers

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
description: Students will convert between metric units (e.g., meters to centimeters, kilograms to grams) and use these conversions to compare quantities.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly moving the decimal point (direction or number of places).

IXL: IXL Content - W.7 Convert and compare metric units

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
skill_name: Converting Customary and Metric Units using Proportions
description: Students will use proportions and given conversion factors to convert between customary and metric systems.
common_pitfalls: Setting up the proportion incorrectly.

IXL: IXL Content - W.8 Convert customary and metric units using proportions

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
skill_name: Converting Between Customary and Metric Systems
description: Students will perform conversions between the two measurement systems using appropriate conversion factors, possibly without explicitly setting up a proportion (though the understanding should be there).
common_pitfalls: Using the wrong conversion factor. Multiplying instead of dividing, or vice-versa.

IXL: IXL Content - W.9 Convert between customary and metric systems

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
skill_name: Comparing Temperatures Above and Below Zero (Measurement Context)
description: Students will compare temperatures using positive and negative numbers, reinforcing their understanding of ordering rational numbers in a real-world measurement context.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting negative temperature values.

IXL: IXL Content - W.10 Compare temperatures above and below zero

common_core_description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units; manipulate and transform units appropriately when multiplying or dividing quantities.
description: Students will convert temperatures between the Celsius and Fahrenheit scales using given formulas.
common_pitfalls: Errors in order of operations. Calculation errors with fractions or decimals.

IXL: IXL Content - W.11 Convert between Celsius and Fahrenheit

common_core_description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.
description: This foundational skill introduces the concept of a statistical question as one that can be answered by collecting data where there will be variability in the data.
common_pitfalls: Confusing a single-answer question with a statistical question.

EngageNY: EngageNY - Lesson 2: Statistical Questions

common_core_description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.
description: Students will practice identifying whether a given question is a statistical question or not.
common_pitfalls: Still struggling to differentiate between questions with single answers and those with varied answers.

IXL: IXL Content - JJ.1 Identify statistical questions

common_core_description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.
description: Further reinforcement and varied examples to ensure solid recognition of statistical questions.
common_pitfalls: Generating questions that might have a single answer, or questions that don't involve data collection.

common_core_description: Reporting the number of observations.
description: This introductory skill focuses on the fundamental idea of collecting and reporting individual observations that form a data set, setting the stage for describing distributions.
common_pitfalls: Not understanding what constitutes an "observation" or a "data set."

common_core_description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.
description: Students will learn to characterize the overall shape of a data distribution, primarily focusing on symmetry and skewness, often from visual representations like dot plots or simple histograms.
common_pitfalls: Confusing skewed left with skewed right.

common_core_description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.
skill_name: Identifying Clusters, Gaps, & Peaks in Data Distributions
description: Students will locate and describe key features within a data distribution, such as clusters (where data is grouped), gaps (where there is no data), and peaks (high points or modes).
common_pitfalls: Misidentifying or overlooking features.

common_core_description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.
skill_name: Describing Distributions on Histograms (Shape and Features)
description: Students will analyze and describe the shape (symmetric, skewed) and features (clusters, gaps, peaks) of data distributions specifically represented by histograms.
common_pitfalls: Confusing bars in a histogram with individual data points.

EngageNY: EngageNY - Lesson 8: Describing Distributions on Histograms

common_core_description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.
description: Students will analyze and describe the shape (symmetric, skewed) and features (clusters, gaps, peaks) of data distributions specifically represented by line plots (dot plots).
common_pitfalls: Miscounting frequency in line plots.

IXL: IXL Content - JJ.11 Describe distributions in line plots

common_core_description: Describing the nature of the attribute under investigation, including how it was measured and its units of measurement.
skill_name: Understanding and Describing Data Sets as Numerical or Categorical
description: Students will differentiate between numerical (quantitative) data (measurable quantities) and categorical (qualitative) data (categories or labels).
common_pitfalls: Confusing counts of categories as numerical data of the category itself.

EngageNY: EngageNY - Lesson 1: Got Data?

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
skill_name: Representing Data Graphically using Dot Plots
description: Students will learn to create dot plots (also known as line plots) as a simple way to display numerical data, showing the frequency of each data point.
common_pitfalls: Not spacing dots/X's evenly. Forgetting to include a number line.

EngageNY: EngageNY - Lesson 3: Representing Data Graphically

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: This skill provides focused practice on constructing dot plots from various numerical data sets.
common_pitfalls: Miscounting frequencies. Not labeling the number line correctly.

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Reinforces the skill of constructing line plots, often using "X" marks instead of dots. (Note: Often interchangeable with "Dot Plots" in elementary/middle school contexts.)
common_pitfalls: Similar to dot plots; miscounting, labeling errors.

IXL: IXL Content - II.1 Create line plots

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
skill_name: Creating and Interpreting Line Plots with Fractions
description: Students will create and interpret line plots where the data values include fractions or mixed numbers.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly placing fractions on the number line. Difficulty interpreting fractional data.

IXL: IXL Content - II.3 Create and interpret line plots with fractions

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will construct histograms from given numerical data, requiring them to determine appropriate intervals and frequency counts.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly determining intervals. Gaps between bars (unless there's no data). Incorrect frequency counts.

EngageNY: EngageNY - Lesson 6: Histograms

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: General practice in constructing histograms from various data sets, possibly with varying interval choices.
common_pitfalls: Choosing inefficient intervals. Incorrectly tallying data into intervals.

IXL: IXL Content - II.12 Create histograms

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will construct box plots (box-and-whisker plots) from a data set, requiring them to find the median, quartiles, and minimum/maximum values.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly finding the median or quartiles. Misplacing points on the number line.

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will interpret the components of a given box plot (median, quartiles, range, interquartile range) and draw conclusions about the data distribution.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting the segments of the box plot.

IXL: IXL Content - II.21 Box plots

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will organize raw data into frequency charts (or frequency tables) by tallying occurrences of each data value or category.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly tallying or counting frequencies.

IXL: IXL Content - II.4 Create frequency charts

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will extend frequency charts to include relative frequency, typically expressed as a fraction, decimal, or percentage of the total.
common_pitfalls: Calculation errors when finding relative frequencies. Not expressing in the requested format (fraction, decimal, percent).

IXL: IXL Content - II.6 Create relative frequency tables

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will construct bar graphs to display categorical data or discrete numerical data, showing quantities for different categories.
common_pitfalls: Not labeling axes. Incorrectly drawing bar heights. Gaps between bars in bar graphs.

IXL: IXL Content - II.7 Create bar graphs

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will create bar graphs where the height of the bars represents percentages, often from relative frequency data.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly converting to or representing percentages. Not having the y-axis scale up to 100%.

IXL: IXL Content - II.8 Create percent bar graphs

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will construct double bar graphs to compare two sets of categorical data side-by-side.
common_pitfalls: Not using a clear legend. Misaligning bars for comparison.

IXL: IXL Content - II.10 Create double bar graphs

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will create line graphs to display numerical data that shows trends over time or continuous change.
common_pitfalls: Not labeling axes correctly. Not connecting points with lines. Using for inappropriate data (e.g., categorical).

IXL: IXL Content - II.15 Create line graphs

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will construct double line graphs to compare trends or changes of two related data sets over time.
common_pitfalls: Not using a clear legend. Plotting points on the wrong line.

IXL: IXL Content - II.17 Create double line graphs

common_core_description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.
description: Students will create stem-and-leaf plots to organize and display numerical data, showing the shape and distribution of data while preserving individual data values.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly splitting stems and leaves. Not ordering leaves. Forgetting a key.

IXL: IXL Content - II.19 Create stem-and-leaf plots

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will analyze information presented in line plots (dot plots), identifying measures of center, spread, clusters, and gaps, and answering questions based on the data.
common_pitfalls: Miscounting frequency, misinterpreting the number line.

IXL: IXL Content - II.2 Interpret line plots

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will understand and draw conclusions from data presented in categorical forms, often through simple lists, frequency tables, or bar graphs (without necessarily creating them).
common_pitfalls: Confusing quantity with categories.

IXL: IXL Content - II.5 Interpret categorical data

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will analyze information presented in bar graphs, comparing quantities across different categories and drawing simple conclusions.
common_pitfalls: Misreading the scale on the y-axis.

IXL: IXL Content - II.9 Interpret bar graphs

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will compare and contrast data from two different sets presented on a double bar graph.
common_pitfalls: Misreading the legend. Incorrectly comparing bars.

IXL: IXL Content - II.11 Interpret double bar graphs

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will understand information presented in histograms, focusing on the distribution's shape, spread, and identifying intervals with highest/lowest frequencies.
common_pitfalls: Confusing histograms with bar graphs. Not understanding intervals.

EngageNY: EngageNY - Lesson 7: Using Histograms to Answer Statistical Questions

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: General practice in interpreting various histograms, including identifying modes (peaks), ranges, and making inferences about the data based on the overall shape.
common_pitfalls: Estimating values within intervals.

IXL: IXL Content - II.13 Interpret histograms

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will analyze information presented in circle graphs (pie charts), understanding parts of a whole and calculating percentages or actual values.
common_pitfalls: Miscalculating actual values from percentages.

IXL: IXL Content - II.14 Interpret circle graphs

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will understand trends, changes, and rates of change shown in line graphs, often over time.
common_pitfalls: Misinterpreting increasing/decreasing trends. Not understanding the time axis.

IXL: IXL Content - II.16 Interpret line graphs

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will compare trends from two data sets displayed on a double line graph, identifying points of intersection, divergence, and overall comparisons.
common_pitfalls: Misreading which line represents which data set.

IXL: IXL Content - II.18 Interpret double line graphs

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will analyze data displayed in stem-and-leaf plots, including finding measures of center (median, mode), spread (range), and identifying clusters or outliers.
common_pitfalls: Incorrectly reading values from the plot (especially with the key). Miscalculating median/range.

IXL: IXL Content - II.20 Interpret stem-and-leaf plots

common_core_description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context.
description: Students will evaluate and choose appropriate data displays for different types of data (numerical, categorical, time-series) and purposes (showing frequency, trends, comparisons).
common_pitfalls: Not understanding the strengths and weaknesses of each display type.

common_core_description: Reporting the number of observations.
skill_name: Reading Dot Plots & Frequency Tables (Number of Observations)
description: Students will practice accurately extracting the total number of observations from a dot plot or a frequency table.
common_pitfalls: Miscounting, especially with line plots where "X"s might be dense.

common_core_description: Reporting the number of observations.
description: Students will practice accurately extracting the total number of observations from a histogram by summing the frequencies of all intervals.
common_pitfalls: Forgetting to sum all bar heights.

common_core_description: Recognize that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number, while a measure of variation describes how its values vary with a single number.
skill_name: Interpreting Measures of Center and Variability
description: This skill focuses on understanding what the mean, median, mode, range, and MAD represent in the context of a data set.
common_pitfalls: Confusing the different measures. Not understanding their interpretations.

IXL: IXL Content - JJ.10 Interpret measures of center and variability

common_core_description: Giving quantitative measures of center (median and/or mean) and variability (interquartile range and/or mean absolute deviation), as well as describing any overall pattern and any striking deviations from the overall pattern with reference to the context in which the data were gathered.
skill_name: Finding the Mean of a Data Set (Fair Share)
description: This skill introduces the concept of the mean as a "fair share" distribution, where the total is divided equally among the data points.
common_pitfalls: Not connecting the "fair share" concept to the calculated mean.
